TextSection.Contents: SCALP syndrome is a rare skin disease characterized by the association of sebaceous nevus and aplasia cutis congenita (usually on the scalp and face) in conjunction with limbal dermoid of the eye, a giant congenital melanocytic nevus and variable central nervous system abnormalities, including seizures, hydrocephalus, neurocutaneous melanosis, arachnoid cysts, and diffuse unilateral hemishpere enlargement.

Synonym.label: Sebaceous nevus-CNS malformations-aplasia cutis congenital-limbal dermoid-pigmented nevus syndrome
Sebaceous nevus-central nervous system malformations-aplasia cutis congenital-limbal dermoid-pigmented nevus syndrome
